scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible churn prediction model deployed by a consumer banking institution.  The attacker uses a model inversion attack to infer individual customer attributes, specifically income and credit score, violating customer privacy regulations.
initial_goal: Evaluate the robustness of the deployed customer churn prediction model by assessing its vulnerability to various attack techniques.
enterprise_context: Consumer Banking: The AI model predicts customer churn based on anonymized customer data.  The prediction API is publicly accessible for research purposes, but the underlying data is strictly protected.
